mineSweeper

Class MineButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • mineSweeper.MineButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class MineButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
    Author:
    Tom Leibovich and Roee Shachar MineButton represents a cell in the game panel - which is a button with a few states - clicked/unclicked, flagges/unflagged and mined or not. It has many methods involving the game and all of its states, most of them occur inside the button itself and update details in the game panel which contains it. NOTE: this class has many methods. Therefore, the methods are sorted alphabetically.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • column

        public int column
        indicates the row and column of this button

      • row

        public int row
        indicates the row and column of this button

    • Constructor Detail

      • MineButton

        public MineButton(int mined,
          int row,
          int column,
          GamePanel parent,
          int buttonSize)
        The single constructor, simply saves parameters into fields.
        Parameters:
        mined - indicates if there is a mine in this button
        row - the row of the button in the game panel.
        column - the column of the button in the game panel.
        parent - the parent of this button - i.e the game panel.
        buttonSize - the size of this button.

    • Method Detail

      • buttonClicked

        public void buttonClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method is called from the game panel whenever a button is clicked. it checks which button was clicked and calls the relevant methods. if the button is disabled - nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • buttonEntered

        public void buttonEntered()
        this method is called when the mouse entered a button. it changes the icon to a wand if the button is clickable

      • buttonExited

        public void buttonExited()
        if the mouse exited the area of the button it returns to be without a picture. if is flagged nothing happens.

      • explode

        public void explode()
        This method is called when a mine is clicked. it changes the picture into a mine (brocoli) or changes the text if its not found.

      • getcolumn

        public int getcolumn()
        a column getter
        Returns:
        column

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        a row getter
        Returns:
        row

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        returns whether this button is enabled or not.
        Overrides:
        isEnabled in class java.awt.Component

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged()
        returns if the cell is flagged or not.
        Returns:
        true-flagged. false-not

      • isMined

        public int isMined()
        a getter for the mined field.
        Returns:
        1 if the cell is mined. 0 otherwise.

      • press

        public void press(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method is called when a user presses a mouse button. it exists to determine if both buttons are clicked, if they are the bonus method is called. otherwise it sets the relevant field to true - meaning this button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event

      • release

        public void release(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method is called when a user releases a mouse button. it sets the released button to false, meaning it is not pressed right now.
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event

      • rightClick

        public void rightClick()
        This method is called when a right click occurs it calls methods in game panel to update fields specifying how many flags are they and how many of them are on real mines.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean b)
        this method only disables buttons.
        Overrides:
        setEnabled in class javax.swing.AbstractButton

      • setMined

        public void setMined(int i)
        a setter for the mine field.
        Parameters:
        i - 1-mines. 0-non-mined.
